instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
threads.message:
Hi.


I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no backlight. The board had already been worked (when I say worked I mean attacked with a hot poker). After a bit of digging and a lot of F*ing about clearing up everything that had already been done I found what the last guy had missed... I think.

<RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7732</RESISTOR> on the feedback voltage divider to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> both measured 12.51k parallel resistance because of a short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> on the LVDS connector. After 4 hours, it was a short on the LVDS!

Are the MacBook Pro retina and MacBook Air 2011+ LCD connectors the same? They do at least look and fit the same.

There is also no enable signal <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> coming from the PCH.
Any info on this would be great please

threads.title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
threads.message: Connectors are the same. Before fixing the backlight do you even have an image on the LCD? If the connector was shorted there is a good chance the LCD cable will be burned too.

threads.title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
threads.message: Diode mode measurement on pin 3 and 4 of LCD connector with and without LCD plugged in?

threads.title: No backlight, LVDS connectors question.
threads.message:
EDIT: Tested pins 3 - 4 in diode mode both with and without cable 0.75v.
Replaced connector, plugged screen, image there but fuse blown.
